maxPower.description: Power handling vs frequency - excursion and thermal limits
maxPower.reference: WinISD Maximum Power graph (TO BE MEASURED)

thermalTransition.notes: Expected to be lower than sealed (~20-30Hz) due to port loading reducing cone excursion

excursionNull.notes: Near Fb, cone excursion approaches zero - port does the work. Power handling should be very high here.

maxSPL.reference: WinISD Maximum SPL graph (TO BE MEASURED)

displacement.description: Cone excursion at various power levels

atFb.notes: At tuning frequency (25Hz), cone excursion should be minimal even at high power

25Hz.notes: Should be very low due to excursion null

portVelocity.description: Port air velocity - should stay below 15-20 m/s to avoid port noise

monotonicity: maxPower increases with frequency until thermal limit
Below Fb, response drops rapidly (high-pass filter)
Cone displacement at constant power: minimum near Fb, increases above and below
limits: Excursion at Fb should be much lower than sealed at same frequency
transitions: thermal transition should be LOWER than sealed (port helps at low freq)
Expected transition: 20-30Hz for ported vs 45Hz for sealed
Port velocity should not exceed 15-20 m/s at Xmax power
sealedVsPorted: Ported maxPower at 20Hz > Sealed maxPower at 20Hz (port reduces cone excursion)
Ported thermal transition frequency < Sealed thermal transition frequency
Ported F3 < Sealed F3 (lower bass extension)

tolerances.reasoning: Ported calculations more complex than sealed - larger deviations acceptable

notes: VALUES TO BE FILLED IN after running WinISD simulation
Ported box more complex - excursion null, port velocity limits
Key test: Can we match the excursion null behavior near Fb?
